name: Snoopy (itch) (Itizso)
description:
Playable 3D simulation of this   classic handheld electronic game including views of the original packaging and instruction guide . A RetroFab simulation Version 0.9.5 (alpha) Details Title Snoopy Model No. SM-73 Series Game & Watch (Table Top) Manufacturer Nintendo Release Date July 5, 1983 Chipset Sharp SM511 ( 32.768 kHz ) Description

Snoopy must strike down musical notes flying through the air.

Gameplay

Schroeder is playing his piano. The notes fly through the air to where Woodstock is sleeping. Operate Snoopy LEFT or RIGHT to move between four platforms to strike down the notes with his hammer. If a note reaches Woodstock, a miss occurs. If Snoopy moves too far left past the first platform or too far right past the last platform, he'll fall off and a miss will occur. Three misses and the game ends.

Tips
  • Game A is easier with only 3 lines of notes while GAME B is more difficult with 4 lines of notes.
  • Snoopy can only hit down a note when standing on a platform of the same color.
Trivia
  • Snoopy is one of three games that were re-released in the later Panorama Screen format which, with it's tilt-able screen, managed to offer the same gameplay as this Table Top edition but in a more portable format and at a more affordable price.
  • Lucy wakes every 100 points to kick Schroeder's piano to provide a brief intermission.
